alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 28 at 4:59PM CDT until April 28 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Furnas County in south central Nebraska... Central Harlan County in south central Nebraska... * Until 545 PM CDT. * At 458 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Oxford, or 18 miles southwest of Holdrege, and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Storm Chaser Reported. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Furnas and central Harlan Counties. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows.
